meanings.definition: A fishing net with three layers of mesh.
meanings.sent1: The tramel caught many fish in the river.
meanings.sent2: The fishermen used a tramel to catch their dinner.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous otter got tangled in the tramel and had to be rescued.
meanings.sent4: The tramel of the net was like a spider's web, capturing its prey effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The intricate design of the tramel made it an effective tool for fishing.

meanings.sent1: Careful not to tramel your feet in the ropes.
meanings.sent2: The vines tramelled around the tree, creating a natural barrier.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten tried to tramel its owner's shoelaces.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts trameled her mind, making it hard to focus.
meanings.sent5: The spider trameled its prey in silk before devouring it.

meanings.sent1: The heavy rain was a tramel to our outdoor picnic.
meanings.sent2: The lack of funds proved to be a tramel in their plans.
meanings.sent3: The tramel of traffic delayed their arrival at the party.
meanings.sent4: Her fear of failure was a tramel holding her back from trying new things.
meanings.sent5: The tramel of self-doubt clouded his confidence in his abilities.
